rules: Rule1: Either Lab Alpha has approved Substance X or Lab Beta has approved Substance X.
Rule2: Under the condition that Batch 1 has been produced, it has passed the quality check.
Rule3: If Batch 1 has passed the quality check, then Process 1 is compliant with the FDA or if Equipment 1 requires sterilization, then it is not sterilized.
Rule4: If Drug Z is under recall, then Company A is profitable.
Rule5: Provided that Drug Z has been removed from the market, it is safe for consumption.
Rule6: Either adverse effects have been reported for Drug Z or a quality issue has been found with Drug Z.
Rule7: Whenever a quality issue has been found with Drug Z, then if it is not under recall, it has been removed from the market.
Rule8: Under the condition that an internal audit has been conducted at Company A, corrective action has been taken by Company A.
Rule9: If Lab Beta has approved Substance X, then Company A is profitable.
Rule10: Provided that corrective action has been taken by Company A, then if adverse effects have been reported for Drug Z and it is not under recall, Drug Z has been removed from the market.
Rule11: If a regulatory investigation has been opened into Company A, then a lawsuit has been filed against Company A.

Rule12: If a whistleblower has reported on Company A, then in the event that it is not the case that adverse effects have been reported for Drug Z leading to if it is not under recall then it has been removed from the market, a regulatory investigation has been opened into Company A.

Rule13: If Company A has failed an inspection, then provided that it is not the case that adverse effects have been reported for Drug Z leading to if it is not under recall then it has been removed from the market, a regulatory investigation has been opened into Company A.
Rule14: If Drug Z has passed stability tests, then it is under recall.
Rule15: If Company A has submitted a renewal, then it holds a valid manufacturing license.
Rule16: Company A has submitted a renewal or it is compliance certified.
Rule17: If Sample 1 is contaminated with Bacteria Y, then Company A is profitable.
Rule18: If Company A is compliance certified, then an audit has been completed at Company A.
Rule19: If a warning letter has been issued to Company A, then fines have been imposed on Company A.
Rule20: Whenever fines have been imposed on Company A, then major violations have been found at Company A.
Rule21: If Company A has initiated a voluntary recall, then a recall notice has been issued by Company A.
Rule22: Under the condition that product retrieval has been completed by Company A, Drug Z has been removed from the market.
Rule23: Provided that the recall process has been verified by the recall team, then if a recall notice has been issued by Company A, product retrieval has been completed by Company A.
Rule24: If Sample 1 has been rejected by the quality department, then it has been flagged for review.
Rule25: If Sample 1 has been flagged for review, then it has been sent to retesting.
Rule26: If Sample 1 has been sent to retesting, then it is cleared for use.
Rule27: If Sample 1 has been sent to retesting, then it is not cleared for use.
Rule28: If Equipment 1 requires sterilization, then it is sterilized.
Rule29: If it is not the case that if Lab Alpha has approved Substance X then Sample 1 is contaminated with Bacteria Y, then Sample 1 has been rejected by the quality department.
Rule30: If it is not the case that either a whistleblower has reported on Company A or it has failed an inspection, then production has been halted at Company A.

Rule31: If it is not the case that if an audit has been completed at Company A then if adverse effects have been reported for Drug Z then if it is not under recall it has been removed from the market, then minor violations have been found at Company A.
Rule32: If it is not the case that either Formula 1 meets the standards or Company A is profitable, then Equipment 1 requires sterilization.

Rule33: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if an audit has been completed at Company A then if adverse effects have been reported for Drug Z then if it is not under recall it has been removed from the market then it is not the case that minor violations have been found at Company A, then a warning letter has been issued to Company A.
Rule34: If Drug Z is not under recall, then Company A has initiated a voluntary recall.
Rule35: If Drug Z has not passed stability tests, then extended shelf life has been granted to Drug Z.
facts: Fact2: An internal audit has been conducted at Company A.
Fact3: The recall process has been verified by the recall team.
Fact4: It is not the case that Process 1 is compliant with the FDA.
Fact5: It is not the case that Drug Z is safe for consumption.
Fact6: It is not the case that a lawsuit has been filed against Company A.
Fact7: It is not the case that production has been halted at Company A.
Fact8: It is not the case that extended shelf life has been granted to Drug Z.
Fact9: It is not the case that Company A holds a valid manufacturing license.
Fact10: It is not the case that major violations have been found at Company A.
Fact11: It is not the case that Formula 1 meets the standards.
